cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi (180 km) SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, crossing western Cuba Friday, then turning north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (between Morgan City and Grand Isle)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire northern Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama, with greatest threat along the Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–55 kt) are increasingly likely late Sunday into Monday with a 55 % cumulative chance; low (12 %) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 3–5 ft of surge into Calcasieu Lake and adjacent bayous if the center tracks east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches of rainfall possible Sunday–Monday, producing flash-flood risk in the Lake Charles area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands beginning late Sunday.
